intro: Glinus trianthemoides, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Glinus trianthemoides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
